title: Detained Milford teen’s parents ordered to wear ankle monitors
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Local News The 16-year-old was briefly detained by ICE last week.
Itamar de Oliveira — father of Gustavo Henrique Oliveira, the teen picked up by ICE in Milford — wipes tears from his eyes as he stands beside his wife and Gustavo’s mother, Lenice Keila dos Reis.
Community members prayed with them before the pair went into an ICE check-in in Burlington.

title: Ban on two-wheeled food delivery vehicles gets cold reception in City Council
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Local News The city is taking some measures to crack down on the vehicles, but support for an outright ban appears thin.
Police investigate a crash between a pedestrian and an e-bike delivery driver in front of the Boston Public Library in August 2025.

Lane Turner/Boston Globe Members of the Boston City Council are beginning to debate the potential ban of mopeds, scooters and other similar vehicles from being used by third-party food delivery drivers.

title: As playoff race tightens, Red Sox desperately need Alex Bregman’s bat to wake up
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Red Sox "There's nothing that can kind of prepare you for playing in this type of environment this late in the season, for what's at stake.
" Alex Bregman has struggled to find his game down the stretch.

(Danielle Parhizkaran/Globe Staff) By Conor Ryan September 18, 2025 | 6:21 AM 4 minutes to read When the Red Sox crafted a three-year, $120 million contract to Alex Bregman in February, the expectation was that the two-time World Series champion’s veteran mettle would pay dividends for a roster yearning for October baseball.
